description.narrative: The proposed project's main development objective is to demonstrate, in the Egyptian context, the applicability of market-based financial/technical approaches in order to be able to achieve significant pollution abatement in selected hot spots areas in and around the Alexandria and Greater Cairo areas. The development objective outcome will be measured by the decrease in pollution loads in the selected hot spot areas. The target for this indicator will be the achievement of at least 75% reduction in the quantity of pollutants emitted by the target companies in each of the targeted hot spots. The proposed project will also be a vehicle for supporting the Government of Egypt to take advantage of the opportunities offered by the emerging carbon market established after the entry into force of the Kyoto Protocol in February 2005.

title.narrative: Particulate matter reduction achieved under the project

comment.narrative: TSP emissions in Arab Abu Saad and Tabbin Areas: 36,000 tpa
TSP reduction to 52,000 tpa in Arab Abu Saad and Tabbin Areas.
Based on previous completed projects plus 190 brick kiln conversion at Arab Abu Saad.

title.narrative: A computerized M &E benchmarking system is in place and covers at least two areas of Alexandria and Qalubyia by end of year one of project

baseline.value: 0 areas have a M&E benchmarking system

target.value: 2 areas have a M&E benchmarking system

actual.value: Completed. The web based management information system (MIS) comprising the following modules: application, prioritization,procurement, disbursement, repayment, monitoring, and completion has been made operational. The M&E system covers both Alexandriaand Greater Cairo

title.narrative: Voume(mass) of COD pollution load reduction achieved under the project

comment.narrative: 4 WWTP commissioned and under monitoring. 4 WWTP are under implementation and another 2 involve process changes to achievewastewatercompliance

title.narrative: Total amount of CO2 reduction from EPAP II project

comment.narrative: For the 11 completed projects plus Arab Abu Saad brick kiln conversion to NG the CO2 reduction is 676,479 tons.
Those populations are indirect beneficiaries who would benefit from pollution reduction as a results of EPAP II subprojects.
The population in Tebbin and Helwan have benefited from reduced emissions from completed sub-projects in South Cairo.

title.narrative: Number of people with exposure to PM10 in the area of the project
Pollution load expressed in terms of most significant pollutant generated by beneficiary companies in selected hotspots decrease byat least 75%

baseline.value: existing situation taken as baseline for each companies in considered hot spots

target.value: 75% reduction in pollution load for main pollutants generated by industrial facilities targeted in the selected hot spots

actual.value: 11 air pollution abatement projects completed, 190 brick kiln conversions were completed at Arab Abu Saad and 1 wastewatertreatment project completed resulting in 94% reduction in TSP, 82% SO2 reduction and 96% reduction in BOD, COD and TSS.

comment.narrative: The reduction is based on data from completed sub-projects. The reduction percentage will change as 6 commissioned sub-projects and14 under implementation reach completion, however the reduction is expected to remain >80%.
